FuncDef:
The access frame-ip lease manage pool-exclude command enables lease management for IP addresses delivered by the RADIUS server but not in the domain address pool.
The undo access frame-ip lease manage pool-exclude command restores the default configuration.
By default, lease management is disabled for IP addresses delivered by the RADIUS server but not in the domain address pool.
CLIs: undo access frame-ip lease manage pool-exclude
Examples: [~HUAWEI] access gateway unnumbered loopback user-type ipoe
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the access gateway unnumbered loopback user-type ipoe command is run to configure gateway unnumbered, the RADIUS server can deliver IP addresses not in the domain address pool to common DHCP Layer 2 users. To enable lease management for these IP addresses, run the access frame-ip lease manage pool-exclude command.
Prerequisites
Gateway unnumbered has been enabled using the access gateway unnumbered loopback user-type ipoe command in the system view.
Configuration Impact
If the BRAS does not receive any Renew or Rebind message from a user terminal after the user's lease expires, the BRAS automatically deletes the user entry to bring the user offline. The lease of a user can be delivered by the RADIUS server. The default lease is three days.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The access frame-ip lease manage pool-exclude command applies only to IP addresses delivered by the RADIUS server to common DHCP Layer 2 users but not in the domain address pool.
If the IP addresses delivered by the RADIUS server are in the domain address pool, you can run the frame-ip lease manage command in the IP address pool view to enable lease management for such IP addresses.
